title: Bug with eth_newFilter and eth_getFilterLogs
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `erigon/2.48.0/linux-amd64/go1.20.5` 

OS & Version:Linux

Chain/Network: Polygon

#### Expected behaviour
`eth_getFilterLogs` re-executes the block and collects log information. Using [this transaction](https://polygonscan.com/tx/0xc2d7dac2549545c9179fa019481614d5fd4742dd33256d4a5bae069112941d6c#eventlog) as an example.

Against a regular Geth node, running the following command:
```
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "eth_newFilter",
  "params": [
    {
      "topics": [
        "0x8c5be1e5ebec7d5bd14f71427d1e84f3dd0314c0f7b2291e5b200ac8c7c3b925"
      ],
      "fromBlock": "0x2B13F9E",
      "toBlock": "0x2B13F9E",
      "address": [
        "0xF25212E676D1F7F89Cd72fFEe66158f541246445"
      ]
    }
  ],
  "id": 31
}
```
and 
```
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "eth_getFilterLogs",
  "params": [
    "0xFILTER_ID_HERE"
  ],
  "id": 31
}
```
returns the following result:
`{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":31,"result":[{"address":"0xf25212e676d1f7f89cd72ffee66158f541246445","topics":["0x8c5be1e5ebec7d5bd14f71427d1e84f3dd0314c0f7b2291e5b200ac8c7c3b925","0x00000000000000000000000025e6bc33060c1fee8e08532d0c1c32c4cbf10e2c","0x00000000000000000000000059e242d352ae13166b4987ae5c990c232f7f7cd6"],"data":"0xffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff","blockNumber":"0x2b13f9e","transactionHash":"0xc2d7dac2549545c9179fa019481614d5fd4742dd33256d4a5bae069112941d6c","transactionIndex":"0x27","blockHash":"0xe296a39e37071bbcf0fc925d9b1190e70d8a5f959156b238ed3b0596f702f147","logIndex":"0x93","removed":false}]}`


#### Actual behaviour
`eth_getFilterLogs` always returns an empty array as a result.
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 31,
    "result": []
}
```


#### Backtrace
Calling eth_getLogs against the same node returns accurate result
````
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "eth_getLogs",
  "params": [
    {
      "topics": [
        "0x8c5be1e5ebec7d5bd14f71427d1e84f3dd0314c0f7b2291e5b200ac8c7c3b925"
      ],
      "fromBlock": "0x2B13F9E",
      "toBlock": "0x2B13F9E",
      "address": [
        "0xF25212E676D1F7F89Cd72fFEe66158f541246445"
      ]
    }
  ],
  "id": 31
}
````
Result:
```

{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 31,
    "result": [
        {
            "address": "0xf25212e676d1f7f89cd72ffee66158f541246445",
            "topics": [
                "0x8c5be1e5ebec7d5bd14f71427d1e84f3dd0314c0f7b2291e5b200ac8c7c3b925",
                "0x00000000000000000000000025e6bc33060c1fee8e08532d0c1c32c4cbf10e2c",
                "0x00000000000000000000000059e242d352ae13166b4987ae5c990c232f7f7cd6"
            ],
            "data": "0xffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff",
            "blockNumber": "0x2b13f9e",
            "transactionHash": "0xc2d7dac2549545c9179fa019481614d5fd4742dd33256d4a5bae069112941d6c",
            "transactionIndex": "0x27",
            "blockHash": "0xe296a39e37071bbcf0fc925d9b1190e70d8a5f959156b238ed3b0596f702f147",
            "logIndex": "0x93",
            "removed": false
        }
    ]
}
```
So it shouldn't be an issue with the state availability.

Any suggestion is appreciated. Thanks!
